CatDescriptText: Frank Watkins, postal employee, 4709 Chartwood Street, North Side, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 7, 1959, pg. 29 with question: "Do you think that the Wacs and others women's units, with the exception of nurses, should be abolished in armed services during peacetime? Why?" answer reads: "In my opinion, the majority of the children and the teenagers are ruling the home today.  This is not like it was when I was a child, because parents do not crack down on the children, and rather let them have their way because they are afraid of hurting them."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Frank Watkins, wearing flecked overcoat and hat with band, standing in front of set of paneled wooden doors, decorative interior in background
